journal-meta.journal-subtitle: Research, Theory, & Application in Psychology and Related Sciences

abstract.p: Strick, Madelijn, Dijksterhuis, Ap, & van Baaren, Rick B. (2010). Unconscious-Thought Effects Take Place Off-Line, Not On-Line. Psychological Science, 21(4), 484–488. (Original DOI: 10.1177/0956797610363555)

body.p: In Experiment 2 of this article, the percentage of participants who chose their on-line favorite was tested against a chance level of 11%, given the nine choice options. It should have been tested against a higher chance level, because some participants (26.1%) had multiple on-line favorites. In the unconscious-thought condition, chance level was 19%; in the conscious-thought condition, chance level was 13%; and in the immediate-decision condition, chance level was 17%. The percentage of people choosing their on-line favorite was marginally above chance level in the immediate-decision condition (36.7%), t(29) = 1.82, p = .08, and did not differ from chance in the unconscious-thought condition (22.6%), t(30) = 0.47, p = .64, or the conscious-thought condition (19.4%), t(30) = 0.90, p = .38.
